      • delete

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String delete(org.springframework.ui.Model m,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                               @CookieValue(value="ACC_SESSION")
                                                                                               java.lang.String accountCookie,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="password")
                                                                                               java.lang.String password,
                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="CSRF")
                                                                                               java.lang.String csrfToken)
                                                                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                                               java.io.IOException
        When you go to the delete page with a post method
        Parameters:
        m - : The model
        request - : The request made
        response - : The response given
        accountCookie - : The cookie from the account
        password - : The password to delete the account
        csrfToken - : The token to prevent CSRF (Cross side request forgery)
        Returns:
        delete to get the correct template
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - : when response isn't good
        java.io.IOException - : When response isn't good

        Parameters:
        date - Date to check
        Returns:
        True if date is earlier than date + CSRFExpiry, false otherwise

      • register

        @RequestMapping(value="/register",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String register(@RequestParam(value="email",required=true)
                                                                                                   java.lang.String email,
                                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="password",required=true)
                                                                                                   java.lang.String password,
                                                                                                   @RequestParam(value="name",required=true)
                                                                                                   java.lang.String name,
                                                                                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                                                                                   org.springframework.ui.Model m)
                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Actualle registering an account
        Parameters:
        email - : The email used when registering, has to be unqiue
        password - : Password for the account, minimal 8 characters, maximal 32 characters
        name - : the username for the account
        response - : The response from the server
        m - : The model / template
        Returns:
        Null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - : When the input / output is incorrect
